title: â€Through the Fireâ€ By Chaka Khan
text:
My dearest Suresh,
The moment we met on that train and you played Through the Fire for me, I didn't realize that it was going to be the soundtrack of our life together. It has continued to define our relationship: a deep love willing to take every chance and every step â€œthrough the fireâ€ for each other.
Now, looking back at almost 34 years of marriage and nearly 40 birthdays together, I see how that song perfectly captured us. We've faced challenges and embraced blessings, and built a life filled with music, laughter and love! I thank God for our three biggest blessings- Noah, Talya and Eli! It's truly wonderful to see them carrying on the music that brought us together. They are living proof of the harmony we created.
Suresh, I love you more today than when we met on that train and my love for you continues to grow every day. I am truly so lucky to have you as my forever melody!
Happy 60th birthday Suresh. Likus! To the song that helped start it all. I hope for many more years to celebrate together. I will always walk through the fire for you!
Love
Me

title: â€œFuneral for a Friend/Love Lies Bleedingâ€  By Elton John
text:
Whenever I hear this song, I immediately think of you. I remember piano lessons in India with Mr. Melvin and really wanting to learn this song. It took me a while but with yours and Mr. Melvin's help, I finally got it all down on the piano and I was so excited. Partly because it was probably the hardest song I had learned at that point, but mostly because I knew you loved this song and I was so excited to show it to you, my greatest musical inspiration.
You have always been and will always be a huge inspiration in my music, and in my life in general, and I am forever grateful to have been blessed to have you as my dad. I look forward to many more years together where we can cook, travel and play lots and lots of music!
Happy 60th Birthday dad. I love you so much.
Love,
Noah

title: â€œForget Youâ€ By Cee Lo Green
text:
There are so many songs that make me think of you, Dad, it was almost impossible to choose just one. I chose â€œForget Youâ€ in the end because it is one of the first songs I remember recording with the whole setup we now use often. I remember it being you, MJ, Marieke, Chach and I in the Bangalore house. I remember feeling so professional, and it was so much fun recording it with you. Since then, we have recorded so many songs with you, and it has given me one of the greatest gift:  a million memories through music.
I am grateful every day that music is something you chose to share with us. You have always been and continue to be my role model in so many ways, when it comes to work, cooking, showing up for those that matter most to you, and most of all, music. I am so grateful to have you as my dad and my role model in all aspects of life. I love you so, so much. Happy Birthday!
Love,
Talya

title: â€œIn the Stoneâ€ By Earth Wind and Fire
text:
If thereâ€™s any musical group or band that I associate with you, it has to be Earth Wind and Fire. I have a very vivid memory of being in the car with you the day you showed me this song specifically. â€œProbably the best album intro of all timeâ€ is what you said to me and I was a little skeptical but I have to agree it probably is. Since the day you showed me the song, itâ€™s quickly become one of my favorite songs and I now have listened to it countless times and shown it to many of my friends, introducing it in the same way you did.
The first 3 drum hits immediately give me a sense of home that reminds me of you, and Iâ€™m very grateful to you (and mom) for encouraging our family to bond through music.
Love,
Eli

title: â€œI Have a Dreamâ€ By ABBA
text: You grew up with music all around you, and it brought me such joy to see how it became part of your life. Happy birthday with all my love.

title: â€œIâ€™ve Been Everywhereâ€ By Johnny Cash
text:
Suresh, I listened to this song while I walked last year and it made me think of you. It reminds me of how you travel all over the world! Your tirelessness always make me marvel about your drive and stamina.
Happy Birthday!

title: â€œEverybody Eats When They Come to My Houseâ€ By Cab Calloway
text: I chose this song because it reminds me of being in Sureshâ€™s house.  I always leave with a full belly and a full heart. Your cooking makes me proud!

title: Anything by Billy Joel
text:
I keep thinking about how that one Billy Joel cassette â€” seemingly the only one we had during those endless road trips around Malaysia â€” became what first connected us as siblings through music. You brought cool music into our home. Bread, Elton John, REO Speedwagon. the Alessi Brothers (!), ELO â€” the soundtrack of our youth. Watching you at the piano, deciphering chords from the tattered and much beloved Let It Be Me songbook, inspired me to play the piano for fun every day. You made music feel like it was ours, and your â€œbandâ€ at church camp made me so proud to have such a cool big brother.
I carry a quiet gratitude for that. You didnâ€™t just share songs â€” you shared something that shaped how music is now such a source of comfort, camaraderie and nostalgia; every familiar melody feels like a thread back to those days. Thank you for the music, the memories, and for being my Acha.

title: â€œYouâ€™ve Got a Friendâ€ By James Taylor & Carole King
text: James Taylorâ€™s â€œYouâ€™ve Got a Friendâ€ reminds me of the brotherly relationship I have with Suresh. Although I have thankfully never had the need, the song talks about being there when times are tough â€” when â€œyouâ€™re down and troubledâ€ â€” and I always think that if I was in that situation, I would have no hesitation reaching out to Suresh, for advice, guidance, and a practical solution.  Like the song says, â€œYou just call out my name, and you know wherever I am, Iâ€™ll come running.â€ I feel this is how he is, and I would be the same for him.

title: â€œRainbow Connectionâ€ By The Muppets
text:
I chose this song, because when I listen to it I remember one of the winters you came to visit while I was in high school. You came with my dad (recently out of shoulder surgery) to pick me up from basketball practice, and for some reason the two of you made me decide who was driving me home: my one-armed dad or my colorblind uncle.
Also, I think that was around the time I learned about how you would go out early in the mornings to fish, and because for some reason I also often picture you sitting on your boat while the song plays in the background.

title: â€œSpeak Softly Loveâ€ By Carlo Savina & Nino Rota
text: Suresh Papa, I just wanted to tell you how blessed I feel to have you in my life, even though we donâ€™t see each other very much. I love it when you visit and cook for us, even though you trick me to eat weird things.  Iâ€™m always proud to tell people youâ€™re my Godfather. Thank you for being someone I can look up to and feel connected to, no matter the distance.

title: â€œPiano Manâ€ By Billy Joel
text: Iâ€™ve witnessed your love for music for as long as I can rememberâ€¦even from the time I was a little child. Wherever there was a piano you would play it and it would change the whole atmosphere of the home and brighten up everyoneâ€™s mood. Your love for music has extended to your 3 beautiful children and itâ€™s so beautiful to see when you all perform together . Music is in your familyâ€™s soul. Congratulations and happy 60th birthday Big Brother. Love youğŸ˜˜.

title: â€œPiano Manâ€ By Billy Joel
text: I picked this song as Suresh Appapen (sorry if I butchered the name) is a fantastic piano player. I saw a video of him and an uncle playing the piano and singing and always thought it was really impressive. I remember being envious that Uncle Suresh, my dad, Auntie Sereen and other relatives could play the piano so well and that was one of the reasons I wanted to start learning to play.

title: â€œMona Lisas and Mad Hattersâ€ By Elton John
text:
Suresh, in my opinion, a sign of a good musician is someone who can make you re-evaluate, re-listen and/or re-discover an existing song in a new light. That's just what you did for me with this song, so THANK YOU! Much appreciated! Now, every time I hear it, I am happily reminded of you.
Iâ€™ve known this song, had it in my play list, liked it (big Elton John fan) but, it never knocked me over - until you performed it, recorded it and sent me the track - kind of out of the blue.
It was great! You displayed/I discovered a new/different level of your musicianship - and it was impressive! Your piano, vox and the feel/vibe of the live recorded performance (assumption) jumped out at me. Itâ€™s simplicity (that's a compliment) and pureness was captured perfectly on the recording.
You caused me to go back and re-listen/re-discover this song, and gain a new appreciation for it. But, I think I like your version better!
Please keep doing stuff like that! It matters - a lot - to me and many others.
Thank you! Love You. Happy 60th b-day! Hope you have a great day and do something fun!

title: â€œMission Impossibleâ€ By Lalo Schifrin
text: Suresh, as you know, part of me seriously believes that you are a spy.  Your work ethic is undeniable.  But, itâ€™s your other qualities like sleep deprivation, computer skills, amazing cooking, musicianship and relaxed demeanor that make me believe that you are a spy.  Thank you for being a person that we all look up to and admire!

title: â€œSheâ€™s a Rainbowâ€ By The Rolling Stones
text: I chose this song because my dear uncle is color blind. One of our inside jokes is me making him guess what colors are around us. I love how I can always be silly with you. You bring joy and color to every room you walk in. Love you Uncle Suresh, happy birthday!

title: â€œMy Cherie Amorâ€ By Stevie Wonder
text: I chose this song for Uncle Suresh because I feel like it emulates the warmth of being in a kitchen, surrounded by family. For as long as I can remember, Uncle Suresh has shown his love for us through his spectacular cooking. He always ensures our times spent together are filled with joy, togetherness, music, and stomachs that are about to burst. I feel so lucky to be able to call him my uncle :)

title: â€œTrulyâ€ By Lionel Richie
text:
How to choose just one song that reminds me of Suresh? Cannot lah â€” too many take me back to my cousin from the estates, whom Iâ€™ve always admired (even while he teased me about my height). Chicago, Earth, Wind & Fire, Genesis, REO Speedwagon, Supertramp, ELO â€” the soundtrack of our youth seems endless.
Still, one memory stands out: Suresh at the piano, easing into that melancholic intro for Truly â€” the left hand tracing a slow descending bass line, setting the mood for a ballad full of longing and beauty. Six decades on, heâ€™s still at it.
So hereâ€™s to a wonderful cousin and human â€” Peter Cetera, Lionel Richie, Dan Fogelberg all rolled into one. Always generous, always ready to share, especially when it comes to music. Happiest 60th, Suresh!

title: â€œPiano Manâ€ By Billy Joel
text:
Dear Suresh,
When we think back, some of our fondest memories of you go right back to childhoodâ€”sitting happily in that high chair at the Sungai Sedu home in the early â€™60s, waiting for your meals with such joy. Music was always close by in those days too. We remember how much Thomas Uncle loved his records, and itâ€™s no surprise that some of that love found its way to you, alongside the gift of talent you already carried.
As a teenager, youâ€™d often come by our place in PB, spending hours lost in music, listening through my AKG headphones. Looking back, itâ€™s clear that those long afternoons were part of the path that led you to where you are today. Weâ€™re so glad you pursued Audio Engineering and grateful to Jibby for encouraging you toward Berklee.
Your piano playing has grown so beautifully over the yearsâ€”itâ€™s been a joy to watch you excel and to see your passion deepen. Weâ€™re so proud of the musician and the man youâ€™ve become. Hard to believe youâ€™re 60 now, but what a journey it has been. God bless you, Cuz.
With love,
David & Serene

title: â€œDonâ€™t Stop Me Nowâ€ By Queen
text: I have chosen this song because to me, uncle Suresh is unstoppable, and always on the go in his fast red sports carğŸš˜!

title: â€œSoldier of Fortuneâ€ By Deep Purple
text: Hey Suresh! Your musical talent is a such a wonderful gift from our dear Father and you have indeed handed that legacy down to your even more talented kids! Keep the music playingâ€¦. You are only 60 & have many more years to keep swinging.

title: â€œThe Sound of Silenceâ€ By Paul Simon
text: When I picked The Sound of Silence for you, Suresh, it wasnâ€™t just because itâ€™s a classicâ€”itâ€™s because it carries something of your spirit in it. At first the song feels simple, but the more you listen, the more depth it reveals, and thatâ€™s how it feels knowing you. Itâ€™s about connection and listening, which is exactly how you move through lifeâ€”bringing people together, guiding with presence more than volume. The shifts in the song, from quiet reflection to something more powerful, remind me of the balance you strike between calm and drive, between thoughtfulness and action. Thereâ€™s a resilience in it too, a steady insistence that feels like your own determination to keep learning, keep building, keep growing. And in the end, it just feels rightâ€”because like you, the song is timeless, thoughtful, and deeply human.

title: â€œMr Robotoâ€ By Styx
text:
Suresh, the real Mr Roberto,
IBM whiz on the go, crossing time zones, sharp as a pro.
Drinks in hand, yet mind's a light,
Music lover, shining bright.
Like Kilroy's ghost, you move with grace,
A hidden strength in every  place,
Not just a robot- heart and soul,
You keep the rhythm, make us whole.
Happy birthday!

title: â€œOn a Cool Summerâ€™s Morningâ€ By Chandrika Tandon
text: Suresh, picture thisâ€”cool Kodai morning, girl walking past, Mundu swishing like it owns the world, muttering things only she understands, firewood flying, lad gawking like heâ€™s just seen a miracleâ€”avan aada pappadam aayi! Heart flips, Sheena barely notices, probably thinking of idlis, maybe humming â€œOn a cool summerâ€™s morning, the world can waitâ€â€”chaos, patience, coffee, more coffee, and somehow â€œmehâ€ blooms into a lifetime of heck yes. Thatâ€™s your love story, Cuz: tripping over itself, laughing at its own mistakes, occasionally nudging someone on the head, and still landing perfectly. Happy 60thâ€”may your mornings stay Kodai-cool, your heart full, and your life gloriously messy.

title: â€œLet It Beâ€ By The Beatles
text: Suresh is a wonderful musician who loves every kind of music. His talent and passion spreads happiness whenever he plays. I love his ability to move easily from soulful songs to lively tunes. I remember him playing Let It Be for one of our get togethers and it is still etched in my mind. For Suresh, music is  a true celebration of fellowship and love.

title: â€œPiano Manâ€ By Billy Joel
text:
Happy Birthday Dear Suresh
Every time I hear Piano Man, I canâ€™t help but think of you, how youâ€™d sit down at the keys and make the whole room pause. There was something in the way you play, like you arenâ€™t  just performing, but living the song. Itâ€™s a memory I carry with me, one of music, meaning, and you just being you.
Wishing you a day filled with the same joy youâ€™ve brought to others through your music.

title: â€œMs. Jacksonâ€ By OutKast
text:
He sang the hook out loud once and we saw he was hiding musicality inside of him ğŸ™‚ made him really human and one of us to a group that admired and respected him as a leader.
Happy Birthday Suresh! thank you for taking a chance on me in 2000 by trusting me to lead a team for the first time. You changed the course of my life and I wouldnâ€™t be where I am today without you guidance and friendship.

title: â€œI Canâ€™t Stop Loving Youâ€ By Ray Charles
text:
For at least the past ten years, Suresh has made sure this song finds its way into my birthday celebration â€” the band striking up those familiar chords while everyone joins in. Itâ€™s become a tradition I look forward to, a moment that always brings a smile because it captures something essential about Suresh himself. The songâ€™s warmth, sincerity, and timelessness mirror him perfectly â€” steady, thoughtful, and always finding ways to connect people through small but meaningful gestures.
Thatâ€™s Suresh for you: the one who remembers, who brings people together, and who somehow makes every occasion feel like a shared memory.
Happy Birthday, Suresh â€” may your life always have a beautiful soundtrack.

title: â€œOld Friendsâ€ By Ben Rector
text: As you turn 60, the line â€œyou canâ€™t make old friendsâ€ speaks about how grateful I am for a lifetime of shared memories that have made us more like old friends than just cousins. The  unpretentious garage setting in that video speaks volumes about you - real, grounded, and filled with genuine warmth. No matter how much time passes or how life changes, â€œyour presence in my life is a pillar I have always been able to lean onâ€, especially more so this year . As we look back, we can clearly see that the most valuable things in life aren't things at all, but treasured memories of estate days, jam sessions & family get-togethers that only grow richer with time. Suresh, even as we move on to this next phase of our lives, the line â€œCan you take me back when we were just kids who weren't scared of getting older?â€ hits different at 60â€”because our special bond makes every decade, from childhood to now, equally precious. Happy 60th Birthday Suresh, Love always, Tanuja

title: â€œYouâ€™ll Never Walk Aloneâ€ By Gerry and the Pacemakers
text:
We chose this song not only because itâ€™s our football club Liverpoolâ€™s anthem. But also because how the words of the song speaks volumes of the importance of family & our faith in God. Just as youâ€™ve not let anyone in your family, both immediate and extended, walk alone through the storms of life, no doubt you have also experienced how family & your faith in God are so important in giving you hope and knowing that you have not walked these 60 years alone and has helped shape the talented, loving and strong son, brother, husband, father, cousin & friend you are. Hereâ€™s wishing you a happy 60th birthday, Suresh.
YNWA

title: â€œSmoke on the Waterâ€ By Deep Purple
text: During a church camp in Singapore, a group of us performed this classic â€” with Suresh at the piano, launching into the iconic opening riff with such enthusiasm that he nearly broke the instrument. It remains one of our most unforgettable musical moments.

title: â€œYouâ€™re the Inspirationâ€ By Chicago
text: When I think of you Suresh, what comes to mind is how smart and talented you were even as a young boy. I remember you enjoyed cooking and introduced us to your own homemade bourbon biscuits in your Mentakab house. And you used to play the piano by ear. You could just pick out any song and figure out the melody and chords. I was totally mesmerised when you taught me to play that catchy introduction to â€œYouâ€™re the Inspirationâ€ by Chicago. You were amazingly talented back then and youâ€™re still an inspiration to us all now with your down-to-earth attitude, your kindness and your creativity. Hereâ€™s wishing you many more years of good health, good food, and wonderful music! ğŸ¶

title: â€œHey Judeâ€ By The Beatles
text: Happy birthday Suresh ! The first time I heard you sing was at a youth camp in  Singapore where you sang Hey Jude ! I always relate that song to you singing it and I guess that was my first exposure to â€œlive musicâ€  as a 12/13 year old . Great way to start enjoying music.

title: â€œHere I Go Againâ€ By Whitesnake
text: Happy milestone birthday Suresh ! I will always remember the song Here I go again by Whitesnake that you sang at a jam session after our SPM years. This was one of your favourite songs at the time. Now Iâ€™m thinking of â€˜Both sides nowâ€™.

title: â€œHave You Ever Seen the Rainâ€ By Creedence Clearwater Revival
text: Every time Have You Ever Seen the Rain comes on I straight away think of you at the piano, doing your own version. Not sure if that style has a name or just â€œSuresh special edition.â€ Iâ€™ve sung that song with you a few times and somehow you make even my off-key parts sound okay. You always push me to try something different, then pretend like it was my idea. Classic you. Anyway, keep that twist going â€” just donâ€™t start charging us to listen next time, can?

title: â€œLean on Meâ€ By Club Nouveau
text: Context to this song originally written by Bill Withers - he had moved away and missed the community ethic of his hometown. I chose this song because i feel Suresh prob misses his homecountry/town vibe at times and attempts to create that wherever he goes. He is 100% dependable, and someone everyone can lean on. No matter what his own life tosses up, he is there for everyone. Everyone is in need of help at some point or another, so also a reminder to Suresh to know he can lean on others. I like this Club Nouveau version because it has this go-go beat and you canâ€™t help but bop to it.

title: â€œSoldier of Fortuneâ€ By Deep Purple
text:
I chose this song because eons ago, the Vadaketh family used to have Annual Christmas Gatherings, where all relatives would congregate, eat, drink and be merry, as they say. There was always the inevitable Sing Along, with many taking turns to sing, Kunyam, VC, Easaw, Jo etc etc.. There would be the usual cousins at the one piano.. David, Peter and then Serene and others who came later. In the earlier days, the younger people were occasionally asked  to sing or perform. I recall one such performance by Suresh.
He was quite young (canâ€™t remember whether he had attained his current height at that time!). He sat at the piano, played, and sang â€˜Soldier of Fortune, into a mic placed by his side. I didnâ€™t know the full lyrics of the song myself at that time, learnt them later.. It remains on the playlist of my ultimate favourites, and I can still picture Suresh, even today, playing and singing softly that eve ğŸ„â€¦ (in the midst of  other older, and much louder Vadaketh male and female voices, I might add ğŸ˜‚). Wonder if Suresh remembers these family performances!

title: â€œPsychic Cityâ€ By Yacht
text:
Happy birthday cuz. Sure you havenâ€™t heard this song before. After your time. Perhaps only in the following gen do artists understand the essence of one from the previous.
Every time the fam is together, like serious big Vadaketh shit, or even small one-on-ones, weâ€™re in a psychic city, and youâ€™re the one telling us about the party; about the cake; about the space that each of us, each darlings to each other even if we donâ€™t know it, hold for each other; and about the dreams weâ€™ll live together.
Love you
Sanjeev & Sudhir

title: â€œMy Sharonaâ€ By The Knack
text: Suresh and I grew up together, looks like we started crawling together, went hiking fishing etc and heard new music together. In the early days of ' sampling' ie hearing something you liked on the radio, buying a good cassette and asking the local music shop guy to record a list for you, this was a song we both heard independently and thought was fun. Reminds me of our younger days filled with laughter song and dancing ğŸ¥°

title: â€œHighway Starâ€ By Deep Purple
text:
Hi Suresh,
1966 was an amazing year for music. â€œPaperback Writer, Eleanor Rigby, â€œGreen ,Green Grass of Homeâ€ all made it to the charts. Across the Atlantic, The Beach Boys were making waves with Good Vibrationsâ€ . Both Frank Sinatra and hos daughter Nancy had hits too , â€œStrangers in the Nightâ€™ and â€œThese Boots are made for Walkingâ€ . I wonder if this had influence on your musical inclinations.
Beside your talent and love music I associated you with fast cars. I remember around the mid 80s, you once drove the MG back from Sitiawan to Klang. I distinctly could hear the shrieking sound of rubber hitting the bitumen as you took a left into Jln Mengkuang. I understand the love for fast cars and speeding tickets has continued after all these years. So as contemplated my song choice , s few songs came to mindâ€ Fast Carâ€ (Tracy Chapman), â€œIâ€™ve in love with my carâ€ (Queen) , â€œLittle Deuce Coupeâ€. But the tune I think epitomizes you on the highway is a tune form 1972, â€œ Highway Starâ€ ! This heavy rock anthem hits all the high notes. My favorite version was Live in Tokyo, 1972, Obviously lots of improvisation , and Iâ€™m sure you â€˜d give Jon Lord a run for his money on the organ. I remember you churning out the chords for â€œ Smoke on the Waterâ€ which was a popular tune with us cousins. But Highway Star showcases some amazing lead guitar from Richie Blackmore, powerful vocals Ian Gillan and Ian Paice on Drums . I read that this has been regarded as one the greatest Live rock openers ever recoded! Enjoy

title: â€œSoldier of Fortuneâ€ By Deep Purple
text:
Apparently, this is one of the few Deep Purple songs where John Lord plays the Mellotronâ€¦ no idea what that isâ€¦ and definitely not why I choose this song. I always knew you were an amazing singer & musician â€“ but the first time I heard you in a â€œconcertâ€ was at the Mar Thoma Youth Camp in Singapore when I was 12 â€“ you were 15, almost 16â€¦ was in aweâ€¦ still am ğŸ˜‰
HAPPY 60TH BIRTHDAY ğŸ‰ğŸ¥‚ God bless always â¤ï¸

title: â€œI Canâ€™t Drive 55â€ By Sammy Hagar
person: Suchit John Jacob and Sunita George
text:
This song is Suresh in musical form â€” full of energy, attitude, and a love for speed. The lyrics capture that unstoppable, thrill-seeking spirit of someone whoâ€™s happiest with their hands on the wheel and the open road ahead. â€œI canâ€™t drive 55â€ isnâ€™t just about breaking speed limits â€” itâ€™s about living life without slowing down, no matter your age.
Sureshâ€™s passion for fast cars and his love for the drive â€” the hum of the engine, the freedom of the highway, and the joy of motion â€” all echo through this rock anthem. Even at 60, heâ€™s proof that some people are born to move fast and never lose their spark.
âœ¨ In short:
Because no matter how many years go by, Suresh still has the need for speed â€” and this song says it loud and proud

title: â€œWalk With Meâ€ By Goldford
text: Suresh, weâ€™ve grown up together and shared so many chapters of lifeâ€”through the thick and thin, always side by side. Started when you were born, I remember growing up together - what a wonderful life - dont you think?  We were blessed or cursed, we had 3 sets of parents. I remember sleep overs and church camps and inter parish games. I recall you broke the 100m race record, wow my cousin. Though I wasn't there to help but always in spirit, you and siblings pulling out the weeds in HQ.  One memory sticks in mind was in one of the plantations where your dad worked (we were young); and we liked a particular sweet wine, we took the bottle without permission and took a few swigs in the tub, don't remember the punishment or we choose to forget. We moved on to the days in Texas and back to Malaysia; every moment since, youâ€™ve been a constant source of laughter, warmth, and strength. You always treated me like a brother, I look at your kids as my own kids, I have treated them as my own and always will. This song reminds me of that steady bond weâ€™ve always had, the kind that doesnâ€™t need words to feel. I know my darling cousin is always by my side, and that brings me peace and joy. Happy 60th birthday, brother. Hereâ€™s to many more years of walking through life together.

title: â€œCountry Roadsâ€ By John Denver
text: â Replace West Virginia with Stiawan, Perak, Carey Island or Mentakab, Pahang. Suresh has a deep nostalgic love for rural Malaysia. For the Beautful estates. The great outdoors. And because of him and his family and their generous hospitality we got to experience and to learn to love them too. Idyllic holidays  all our family treasure.

title: â€œAfricaâ€ By Toto
text:
In retrospect, clearly remember when Africa & Rosanna hit it big late 82' & early 83', Thomas fmly was still living at Golden Hope & we all Klang cuzs & our parents going there all the time.
Remember Suresh was so into Toto music - Africa & Rosana constantly playing, practicing & jamming to these great songs on the keyboard in the front Golden Hope home music room ğŸ¶
His love for music is clearly embodied thru out these songs & his life in music. Happy Blessed 60th Bday  Cuz. God's continued choicest blessings in your life & future endeavors ğŸ™

title: â€œMe and Bobby Mcgeeâ€ By Kris Kristofferson
text:
In between my sailing assessments, given half a chance, I would drive upcountry. The Malaysia that I remember was pristine and truly paradise on earth. Always visiting relatives and friends when possible on these trips.
It was during this time I first got to know Suresh as a young school boy, and I used to see him regularly until he went to college.  Young Suresh was intelligent, curious, and full of life. He still is ever ready to take on new challenges and chances. He was also very sure of what he wanted. A very thoughtful and trustworthy individual.
The ballad  Me and Bobby McGee  by Kris Kristofferson reminds me of the young Suresh, always youthful, carefree, enthusiastic, and ready for any challenge the world had to offer. Listening to the song, I can even picture Sheena McGee complete with a tight colorful bandana by his side.
It would only be fair for me to add that Suresh's siblings and cousins of that generation were all brimming with the same enthusiasm, ready for a world of adventure and action.
They were truly a blessed generation.
A Very Happy Birthday Dear Suresh. You and Sheena have been a blessing for all of us in Singapore and Malaysia.

title: â€œHard to Say Iâ€™m Sorryâ€ By Chicago
person: Deepa George and Shibu Thomas Verghese
text: Back in the early 80s, Shibu and Suresh brought â€œHard to Say Iâ€™m Sorryâ€ to life at camp â€”  Suresh on keys & together with Shibu singing in harmony. Watching them reprise it decades later at Shibuâ€™s 60th this year was nostalgic. Weâ€™re both so grateful to have reconnected with Suresh over the past twelve years and to see him continue using his time and talent to bless others. Iâ€™m (Deepa) also personally grateful for his big brotherly & friendly role in my life ++ as an advisor, beyond us being cousins. Happy milestone birthday Suresh - Enjoy a celebration of the 6 decades being you!

title: â€œNature Boyâ€ By John Coltrane
text:
I visited Malaysia in 1980.
VC took me to Thomas uncles' estate on that trip.
Suresh taught me to ride a motorcycle on his father's estate.
I returned to India and did not see Suresh until....
Suresh landed up unannounced at my dorm at MIT, Boston, USA in 1984 (I think) and stayed with me while transitioning to Berklee School of Music. He was lucky I was in the dorm as otherwise he would literally have been on the streets of Boston. No email, no whatsapp in those days. He has then gone on from strength to strength.
This album by John Coltrane was lost and arrived unannounced (like Suresh) in 2018. 
And the song is about Nature (Suresh is an estate boy).
God bless him for his 60th anniversary and grant him many more years of celebration.
Vikram.

title: â€œSmoke On The Waterâ€ By Deep Purple
text:
We were all teenagers trying to be part of something special.  Music was part of our growing up, expressing ourselves, and obviously a way to impress our peers/ladies/girls.
Back then, the rite of passage to be in a rock band, was to play songs from Deep Purple and Led Zeppelin. Smoke on the Water was the 'it' rock anthem and we had a blast. Happy 60th birthday Suresh and many more.
Best regards,
Sushil

title: â€œHelp is On Its Wayâ€ By Little River Band
text: From brewing me a cup of coffee first thing in the mornings to driving us home to SG through the night, you are always the person that comes to the rescue for the family. â€˜Help Is On Its Wayâ€™ reminds me of all the times, both big and small, that youâ€™ve been there for us - we appreciate you so much! Happy birthday!

title: â€œBanana Pancakesâ€ By Jack Johnson
text:
Hi Uncle Suresh! I picked Banana Pancakes because to me it captures your vibe perfectly: relaxed, light, and somehow always calm no matter whatâ€™s going on. It also reminds me of our waffle sessions, which is one of my favorite things we do together (especially because you make it look effortless while I pretend Iâ€™m helping).
Iâ€™ve loved getting to know you these past few years, from our football chats (Iâ€™m still grateful you havenâ€™t brought up the 2005 UCL finalâ€¦), to the music (I loved playing together!), to the cooking, the traveling, and everything in between. I always look forward to the next time we hang out.
Happy birthday, and hereâ€™s to many more waffles!

title: â€œYou're So Vainâ€ By Carly Simon
text: I have chosen You're So Vain as it perfectly captures our friendship over the years. The song is a reminder of how we didnâ€™t always take life too seriously and screamed perfectly in harmony at all our pub nights. It holds decades of inside jokes, shared family holidays and a bond that ties our families together. Choosing this song is my way of celebrating you with a heap of love. However, it is only because it was the first song that popped into my head â€“ there are thousands I could have chosen.

title: â€œWith A Little Help From My Friendsâ€ By Joe Cocker
text: Iâ€™ve chosen the song With a Little Help from My Friends because it captures the epic air guitar rock sessions, and the unforgettable times in India that often got us through crazy moments with all the help from my friends. Happy Birthday my Boet!

title: â€œFast Carâ€ By Tracy Chapman
text:
Anyone who knows Suresh knows he missed his true calling; he shouldâ€™ve been a Formula 1 driver. Having a little red car hasnâ€™t stopped him from trying though! Not many people can get from Singapore to KL in under two hours ğŸ™ˆ
But beyond the jokes, Suresh has the biggest heart. Heâ€™s the first to offer a ride, lend a hand, or go completely out of his way just to make things easier for someone else. His kindness, patience, and quiet generosity have touched all of us more than he probably realises.
We love you, Uncle/Grampa Driverâ¤ï¸

title: â€œDanger Zoneâ€ By Kenny Loggins
text: I chose this song because itâ€™s pure Uncle Driver energy. The way he speeds around, somehow makes it home in one piece, and still manages to pick me up, feed me, and take Bru for walks. Heâ€™s always there when I need him, no questions asked.  Crazy driving aside, heâ€™s the most caring personal driver and chef, and Iâ€™m so grateful to have him as my other papa! LIKUS

title: â€œHotel Californiaâ€ By Eagles
text: I chose this song because it reminds of when we lived in India this song was always on repeat every weekend. And you guys would always be saying your goodbyes to go home and then this song would play another 1-2 times haha. Happy birthday uncle suresh! I hope you have a great day I love you lots!

title: â€œTambourine Manâ€ By Byrds
text:
What a special birthday is coming up for our beloved â€œDriverâ€ Suresh.  To choose one specific song that represents or symbolizes Suresh is impossible because to us he is THE music man in the â€œfamilyâ€. All our best memories of him (aside from on the golf course) are of him and the family - especially the kids - making beautiful music in your garden in Bangalore or at one of our houses. Wherever he was there was always music, always singing, musical instruments being tinkered with, sing-a-longs, lots of laughter and always lots of love and good food!
We nominate: â€œTambourine Manâ€ by the Byrds as our special song for Sureshâ€™s 60th celebrations. Why?
Firstly, in November 1966 (when Suresh arrived to make our world as special as he does) the Byrds were top of the charts in the US so itâ€™s only appropriate that we choose a hit song they produced in his birth year.
Secondly, Suresh will always be our â€œTambourine Manâ€ â€“ our music maker. In fact, we even have memories of him playing a tambourine on several occasions (as well as many other instruments)! So, we could think of no better song to celebrate him on this milestone birthday and what he represents in our lives and our memories of those wonderful days together in India.
So, to Suresh from us Jonesies: Happy 60th Birthday Mr Tambourine Man â€“ may you continue to make music for many, many years to come. Likis ğŸ•ºğŸ»ğŸ¶ğŸ»

title: â€œCrazy Kiya Reâ€ By Sunidhi Chauhan
text:
You, me and â€œThe Foxy ladiesâ€ have danced to this song so many times and we loved it. Aruns choreography was challenging and difficult.
Now Suresh, as soon as we, Klaus and I, hear Bollywood songs and music now and forever, we think of our years in Bangalore. Together with you, your beautiful family and the rest of our dear friends we had many amazing years. So much memories and love.
You were always a true friend, lovely and generous !!
Have a wonderful birthday, best of luck in your life !
Hope to see you again soon!
Best wishes also from our children, Viktor, Filippa and Hanna.
Lots of love from us, Klaus and Eva Fox
ğŸŒ¸ğŸ¥‚ğŸ‰ğŸŒ¸ğŸ©·

title: â€œYMCAâ€ By Village People
person: Julio and Claudia De Las Casas
text: This song evokes a time (in India) when we watched our children grow up, when friendships were forged that last to this day, filled with joy and constant adventures. Thatâ€™s why we think of Suresh whenever we hear it â€” and how could we forget that spectacular police YMCA outfit!

title: â€œDuncanâ€ By Slim Dusty
text:
Iâ€™m thinking Bangalore times and the gathering of friends - predominantly at the Thomasâ€™s residency - orchestrated by Suresh - gatherer and entertainer (super chef and barman) of friends. Duncan is an iconic Aussie song, by and iconic Aussie artist - written about great mates getting together to celebrate friendship - perfectly written for catching up with the iconic Suresh (aka Duncan) and the rest of my not so iconic mates. Adapted lyrics supplied!!!
I love to have a beer with Suresh
Oh I love to have a beer with Suresh.
We drink in moderation
And we never ever ever get rollin' drunk
We drink at the Thomas bar.
Where the atmosphere is great
I love to have a beer with Suresh.
'Cause Sureshâ€™s me mate

title: â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ By Queen
text:
It was hard to come up with one song, since music and singing and all the fun that comes with all that is what we think about when we think about Suresh.
When this song comes on, it brings back memories of all those wonderful garden parties, where Suresh all of us sang and danced in the warm Bangalore evening airâ™¥ï¸
As with everything weâ€™ve ever seen Suresh do, music in his hands is one more way that he expertly expresses the myriad talents of his truly creative being!!
We have so thoroughly enjoyed the great privilege of being your friends and neighbors in India and beyondâ™¥ï¸
Wishing you a wonderful birthday brother!
ML and Inder

title: â€œHotel Californiaâ€ By Eagles
text: We chose this song because it brings back great memories of our parties in Bangalore. Hotel California reminds us of Suresh because it's such a laid back song and that's the vibe that Suresh always had when we were together, at parties, cooking at home and just hanging out. Best wishes for your birthday, Suresh. We have very special memories of our time in India, and you, Sheena and the kids are a big part of that. We hope the day is spectacular, and wish we were there with you all. With love Robyn, Thomas and Zoe xxx

title: â€œPiano Manâ€ By Billy Joel
text:
Richard and Jackie chose this song because it reminds us of fond memories of our time in Bangalore. On a regular Sunday after brunch, we would be gathered around the piano at Suresh and Sheenaâ€™s house singing our little hearts out. Suresh would nip into the kitchen later and whip up a fantastic plate of something delicious and feed us all. Those were wonderful times with Suresh as a great host. Always welcoming, always hospitable! (It was great seeing you in Houston!)
Happy 60th birthday to our Texan friend, Suresh!

title: â€œJambalaya (On the Bayou)â€ By Hank Williams
text:
Jambalaya brings Suresh to mind because, like the song, heâ€™s all about big flavors, big laughs, and big gatherings. Heâ€™s a fantastic cook who doesnâ€™t just feed people â€” he puts on a feast, whether itâ€™s an enormous, beautifully plated paella, a rich laksa, a bubbling steamboat, or perfectly grilled racks of lamb. Suresh cooks with joy and welcomes everyone with a full glass and a full heart. His warmth and hospitality turn every meal into a celebration and there's always a party wherever he is. Just like the song, he brings people together with warmth, spice, and a whole lot of fun. Happy 60th to the man who makes life taste better! 
From the Mathew family

title: â€œWhat The World Needs Now is Loveâ€ By Dionne Warwick
text: This song was our wedding song.  We were married in 1968.  It was a time when the world was in turmoil.  There was the Viet Nam war, and wide spread racial strife, but we believed in love and positivity.  Suresh travels the world and always spreads positivity, kindness, and respect for everyone he meets.  He is loving, kind and thoughtful, and the world needs more like him.   Happy 60th Birthday Suresh!

title: â€œCheeseburger in Paradiseâ€ By Jimmy Buffet
text:
Delicious, comforting food in a fun and relaxing setting is how I would characterize my experiences with Suresh Thomas over the years, and hearing this song â€˜Cheesburger in Paradiseâ€™ by the â€˜Patron Saint of the Untroubledâ€™ always reminds me of him.
Suresh is often located in or discussing a warm location (Singapore or Hawaii), he never seems stressed, and he is always involved the production or enjoyment of fantastic and comforting food.  Whether hosting meals at his home in Singapore, producing holiday feasts with family or sampling poutine in a Rochester dive bar, quality time, fun memories and delicious tastes are always on the bill when Suresh is present.  Palm trees or not, any time I get to visit Suresh, it feels like a tropical vacation!

title: â€œAround the World (in Eighty Days)â€ By Bing Crosby
text:
I thought of this title due to your travels over the years; not merely in 80 days.
I wish you a special 60th Happy Birthday and enjoy what Sheena and your young adult kiddos have composed for you!
Best wishes!

title: â€œLife is a Highwayâ€ By Tom Cochrane
text: This song seems fitting for Suresh - he treats life like an adventure, he has travelled a lot and he enjoys driving! He has a joie de vivre that is emphasized through this song. He likes sharing experiences and has a genuine interest in people. We also think he is a good cook which is not reflected in the song. And lastly Tom Cochrane is Canadian - he canâ€™t forget us! Happy 60th Birthday to dear Suresh!

title: â€œForever Youngâ€ By Rod Stewart
text:
Turning 60 isnâ€™t just about counting the years-itâ€™s about celebrating the life, love and laughter that fill them.
We chose â€œForever Youngâ€ because it perfectly captures what we wish for you: a heart that stays open, a spirit that stays curious, and a life that continues to be full of meaning and joy.
May you always stay â€œforever youngâ€ in the ways that matter most-in kindness, in laughter, in music and in the joy you bring to the people around you.
Cheers to the years behind you, and the adventures ahead.

title: â€œWhat a Feeling (Flashdance)â€ By Irene Cara
text: Suresh, this 80â€™s hit always makes me think of you.  Many years ago our families were playing volleyball at Laryssaâ€™s place on Lac de Ville and you were in charge of the music.  You put this song on and it brought you such joy. I recall you very seriously telling me what a great song it was, as you sang along. â€œTake your passion and make it happen.â€ Happy 60th! Love, Richelle

title: â€œFire and Rainâ€ By James Taylor
text: So, one of the times we decided to get the band together, you suggested this tuneâ€“so happens it was one of the first songs I ever learned on guitar.  In other words, wishing you many more trips around the sun, so we see each other more than one more time again.  Love, Gordon

title: â€œThe World is Yoursâ€ By Nas
text: Happy Birthday! The world is yours, so act like it. This is one of my favorite tracks for any special occasion. Hope you enjoy it!  Love, Nathan

title: â€œTiny Dancerâ€ By Elton John
text: Happy Birthday! From one Elton John fan to another, a classic that brings nostalgia to every listen.  Enjoy the day!! Love, Shayla

title: â€œBelieverâ€ By Imagine Dragons
person: Natalie, Brian, Logan and Garrett Scott
text:
ğŸ¶ Happy 60th Birthday, Suresh!
The song we picked for you is â€œBelieverâ€ by Imagine Dragons, it reminds us of that Woodlands party when you played it with the kids. That was so much fun having you play with everyone at the party.  Itâ€™s such a perfect song for you, full of energy, rhythm, and heart. â¤ï¸
We love your incredible musical talent and the joy you bring every time you pick up an instrument. Thank you for always filling our home with music, laughter and of course, bread and pizza!
Sorry we canâ€™t be there to celebrate in person, but weâ€™re raising a glass to you from afar. Cheers to 60! ğŸ¥‚
Hereâ€™s to many more years of music, joy, and good times! ğŸ¶ğŸ‚ğŸ’›

title: â€œPure Imaginationâ€ By Gene Wilder and Timothee Chalamet
text:
'Come with me and you'll be
In a world of pure imagination
Take a look and you'll see . . . 
What we'll see will defy
Explanation . . . ''
Suresh met Sheena and both have created a world beyond imagination. Grad school; IBM, etc.; life in Dallas, Bangalore, and Singapore; 3 beautiful children now successful young adults . . . I would say beyond imagination! What will come next: it will defy explanation . . . 
Love you Suresh,
Tom

title: â€œSelamat Ulang Tahunâ€ By Jamrud
text:
Today the day that you've waiting for
Your age increase by  one year, may you be happyâ€¦
I chose this Indonesia song because I'm from Indonesia ğŸ˜Š
What I can give neither a watch or a ring
Not a bunch of flowers or poetry , moreover heart pendant
Is not that I'm cheap or unwilling to spend a little
What I want to give you is sincere prayer
Hopefully you will be given a long and healthy life forever, Happy birthday ...

title: â€œAngels Watching Over Meâ€  By Amy Grant
text:
Suresh really really has his 'angels watching him..'
Have you been in a car with him?
Have you seen him facing his studies, his challenges, his successes & his life's journey?
He never says much but he knows his Lord & his angels are with him & have brought him thus far. 
A wonderful & dependable son, husband, father, sibling, cousin, nephew & friend. He knows Who is with him always! 
Tq Jesus for putting him in my life.
Much love & prayers always. Blessed 60th birthday wishes.
Malini & Ravi
